params.note: This protocol combines pooled CRISPR KO screening with hiPS cellâ€“derived neural organoids and assembloids to investigate genetic regulation of neural development. Adaptations possible for corticogenesis, gliogenesis, striatum, thalamus, cerebellum, interneuron migration, and neurodevelopmental disorders. Requires reporter hiPS lines and adapted readouts. Applicable to human embryonic stem cell cultures. Captures human-specific disease context.

Comparison: 2D hiPS-derived neuronal cultures are scalable and fast but lack developmental intermediates and cell-cell interaction complexity. Neural organoids/assembloids enable study of complex developmental processes. CRISPR + scRNA-seq profiles transcriptional consequences but is low-throughput. This protocol uses bulk genomic DNA sequencing for scalable genome-wide screening and couples with phenotypic assessments.

Limitations: sgRNA off-target effects require multiple independent sgRNAs per gene and orthogonal validation. hiPS cell line variability affects reproducibility; requires pluripotency/genome integrity validation and screening across multiple lines. Batch variability in organoids necessitates QC at multiple stages and biological replicates. Heterogeneous gene disruption complicates genotype-phenotype correlation.
